ccre.ctrl

Class Ticker

  • java.lang.Object
    • ccre.ctrl.Ticker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EventInput

    public final class Ticker
extends java.lang.Object
implements EventInput
    An EventSource that will fire the event in all its consumers at a specified interval.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Ticker(int interval)
      Create a new Ticker with the specified interval.
      Ticker(int interval, boolean fixedRate)
      Create a new Ticker with the specified interval and fixed rate option.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void send(EventOutput ec)
      Adds an EventConsumer to listen for the periodically fired events produced by this EventSource.
      void terminate()
      Destroys this Ticker.
      void unsend(EventOutput ec)
      Removes the specified EventConsumer, so that its eventFired method will no longer be called by this EventSource.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Ticker

        public Ticker(int interval)
        Create a new Ticker with the specified interval. The timer will start immediately, executing for the first time after the specified interval. This will not run at a fixed rate, as extra time taken for one cycle will not be corrected for in the time between the cycles.
        Parameters:
        interval - The desired interval, in milliseconds.

      • Ticker

        public Ticker(int interval,
              boolean fixedRate)
        Create a new Ticker with the specified interval and fixed rate option. The timer will start immediately, executing for the first time after the specified interval. If fixedRate is false, this will not run at a fixed rate, as extra time taken for one cycle will not be corrected for in the time between the cycles. If fixedRate is true, this will run at a fixed rate, as extra time taken for one cycle will be removed from the time before the subsequent cycle. This does mean that if a cycle takes too long, that produces of the event can bunch up and execute a number of times back-to-back.
        Parameters:
        interval - The desired interval, in milliseconds.
        fixedRate - Should the rate be corrected?

    • Method Detail

      • send

        public void send(EventOutput ec)
        Adds an EventConsumer to listen for the periodically fired events produced by this EventSource.
        Specified by:
        send in interface EventInput
        Parameters:
        ec - The EventConsumer to add.

      • unsend

        public void unsend(EventOutput ec)
        Removes the specified EventConsumer, so that its eventFired method will no longer be called by this EventSource.
        Specified by:
        unsend in interface EventInput
        Parameters:
        ec - The EventConsumer to remove.

      • terminate

        public void terminate()
        Destroys this Ticker. It won't function after this.
